very happy lively place, nice walk around it and has a lovely street market on holidays ... enjoyed my walk besides the lake ...
The views from the promenade are lovely but the statue itself is nothing to talk about unless you are a major fan of his.
Like the man himself, the statue is larger than life. It's a good image in a grand place, near the waterfront. Don't miss it if you get to Montreux.
Nothing earth shattering but it's interesting and worth a gander if you are walking around outside down by the lake (places to grab an ice cream whiling strolling too)!
Pay your respects and then look around at the lovely scenery - water on one side with mountains in the background, a charming town on the other.
My husband and I certainly across this statue when we were walking along the lake. After visiting Montreux, we could see why he liked it there so much.

The Statue is set at the very pretty Montreux promenade - so hard to miss if you are planning a leisurely walk. Not something you come for specifically, but a great photo opp for fans and causal visitors alike
It's a statue to a great musician. Not much other than that. But it is along the lakeside walkway of Lake Lemans which is very, very worthwhile to stroll along during the time of the Jazz Festival.
What can you say? It's a statue on the waterfront. Worth a special trip? No. Nice to see if you're there anyway? Sure.

A beautiful statue of Freddie Mercury can be seen on the edge of Lake Geneva, created by the amazing Czech sculptor Irena Sedlecka it can be found just down from the market area. It's a beautiful reminder of how special Montreux was to Freddie Mercury and to the whole Queen

Having a spare day on our Swiss Travel Train pass we worked out an itinerary to use it for a day return trip to Montreux that would allow us to experience this beautiful area by Lake Geneva and take in one of the reasons we had chosen to visit this area. We made the journey on
Not a big rock n roll fan, but other than it being a monument to him, not really much to it. Would not have otherwise been worth the walk

This is just one of several monuments to great musicians. It is a good photo op and if you are there you should take a few minutes here. It is a part of what was a nice walk along Lake Geneva in a very nice town. I would love to be there for the Jazz Festival. I have a feeling
We strolled pass the lake and saw this statue . Not knowing what it is until we were close . It stands in the centre and many tourists around it .
Honestly there's not much to see, just an average statue. If you happen to be walking past it's worth maybe a minute.
It's a good meeting point in Montreux and just beside the hanging pool. An icon from the music world...
Great statue in honour of a fabulous artist! Only trouble we had is the poor guy was covered up for protection from a wood chopping competition on the square!!!

What a fitting tribute to Freddie. A copy of their last album cover if you get the right angle without people standing there ! :-) It's a beautiful setting there in the lake and takes no offers to see.
Statue of Freddy Mercury, who lived often in Montreux, at the lake promenade. Must see for his fans. Great location at the waterfront.
Stumbled upon this memorial as we walked the promenade. It was a nice and pleasant surprise. I must admit that I didn't know this memorial existed and hence hadn't planned for this.
It's an impressive statue, looking out into the lovely lake, but at the end of the day, there's not much more to say. However, it's the most interesting thing to see In Montreux!
its a good photo place with the iconic Freddie Mercury, worth a visit and a great walk by the lake under the trees along side the flowerbeds.
A place of pilgrimage for any Queen fan and a celebration of one of rock music's greatest ever talents. Go early in the morning if you want to be alone with the statue and your Queen memories
Have been to this place today. Excellent memorial for Freddie Mercury. Till today this place remain as one of attraction in Montreux

The Freddy Mercury stands out beautifully among the many art pieces along the path by Lake Geneva. The old phone booth turned into a mechanized piece of art is equally spectacular and worth a few moments.

It's really nice to see this memorial in Montreux since Freddie Mercury did live here for several years. The statue itself is fine, and is recogniseably him, but it is not a work of art. But that's not the point of it anyway!
Glad that I saw this I love his music but.. it's a statue of Freddie mercury... not much else I can say!

I love Queen and Freddie Mercury, but surprised to see this listed as a Montreux "attraction". It is a statue amongst a variety of nice statues, including those of jazz greats, situated along the promenade bordering Lake Geneva. Nice to see and take a photo, but I doubt anyone

Basically it is just a statue. There are plenty of statues by the promenade. The entire Montreaux waterfront is nice. To stroll along the water is a must-do when in this city. You will pass this statue.

So excited when we found this statue of the man himself and couldn't resist assuming this pose myself for a photo!! On the banks of the lake so that Freddie shall be eternally looking out across the lake to the Alps and beyond.....
Very interesting exhibition with Freddie Mercury memorabilia. Free entry and quite small but very well done. Worth a visit if you are in the area.

When in Montreux you should chose the opportunity to visit the museum dedicated to the famous band Queen in the 'Casino Barriere'. Beside many memorabilia you can enter the legendary mountain studio and act like a sound engineer.
On busy days it's hard to get a photo with the statue but it's worth seeing anyway and going a few steps down to the casino to visit the queen studio inside (for free)

It is a statue of Freddie Mercury, nothing more, nothing less. You will see it on your way to the lakeside promenade. It's not a must see, even though the information center might tell you the opposite
Centrally located statue on the promenade overlooking the lake. Flower promenade walk goes past it and its close to restaurants, old market etc. Worth seeing but nothing special in my opinion.
The statue of the great Queen front man is is situated on the promenade next to lake Geneva, which is 400 yards from the Montreux casino.
it's more than a statue, it's a memory of a legend, facing the lake in a beautifull environment. enjoy it.

This is a must see for any Queen fan, very easy to find right along the water. The views from this spot are fantastic! It was pretty crowded with a lot of tourists quickly cycling through to take a photo with the statue! Hang out on the benches for a few minutes and enjoy the

My husband and I are staying in the corniche area, only 10 minute walk from our hotel. The statue is located in a very nice area, close to shoppings, restaurants, amount other attractions. Be aware than during the weekends the area is packed, is better to come during week days.
Its a great spot the look the sun go down and have relaxed moment with people you enjoy to stay with.

Montreux, situated on the banks of Lake Geneva is one of the most beautiful places in Switzerland. Blue skies, sharing their color with the lake, which is surrounded by snow clad mountains is a place straight our of any fairy tale..The energy from the nature is simply

The statue itself, is just a Statue of course, the Legend is unforgettable. It's a nice memorial. The views from this spot are amazing, the lake, the mountains, the food, the people. Although I went to see the statue, I found myself looking around and being amazed at what was

Stumbled upon this along our walk by the lake. It's a nice statue and it has some info about it, there were roses in front of it that people had left. It's in a beautiful location right next to the lake with a lot of different spots to sit and relax. However unless your a big
Great sculpture of Freddy Mercury in a typical entertainment pose. Located next to the lake. No need to go out of your way to come here, but if you are in the neighborhood, by all means...

I was able to go inside the casino and see his recording studio... Such an amazing experience being there knowing that a band Queen has recorded 7 albums there. The memorabilia from the bands was awesome. The lyrics handwritten by Mercury and other band members and the outfits
Who can come to Montreux and not want to see this. As a Queen fan, unmissable. Easily found 50 meters from the Montreux Casino
Really, it's a statue overlooking lake Geneva, it's a good statue and clearly a likeness of Freddie has been maintained. People are often seen doing a selfie or leaving flowers as a memorial
Went there in the evening as everything else was closed for the day. The statue has a good view . Really enjoyed the observation point in front of the statue.
Lots more celeb memorials in Montreux. Nothing remarkable...the park in the front of the palace is better.

The waterfront where the statue is located is lovely. The statue itself is fine, but it's just a statue. Enjoy the waterfront, soak up the sun, and take the 30 seconds it takes to see the statue. You're done. Now get on with your day and enjoy the beautiful promenade.

Leaving the train station We left there in search of our hotel The travel app I had said it was only 12 minute walk Not so... We used the Freddie Mercury Statue as a guide Turned left on the Promanade of Flowers and 20-25 minutes later Arrived. I'm 65 now and my feet hurt We
There really isn't anything to do here accept look at the statue and across the lake. But the view is great and the river walk is a nice calm way to spend an afternoon.
There is not much more to say than that the location is great. Otherwise a statue as many orhers. Interesting is to look up in the internet the story about his famous song 'Smoke on the water'.

I once lived in Zanzibar, Freddie Mercury's birthplace, and have always loved his voice with that amazing range and ability. Walking along the gentrified waterfront in Montreux I was surprised and delighted to see his memorial statue. And of course I took a selfie!
This memorial in on the lakeside walkway, just 100 metres from one of the town centre's main roads. Well worth a visit and a photograph
The statue because Freddie Mercury was staying couple years in this city... its the object picture to several tourist and act like the statue

If you're on Lake Geneva check out Freddie Mercury's Memorial. It's a very popular attraction so you are going to have to time your photos op. as everyone is trying to get 'that' shot in front of his statue. A fitting memorial to a great rocker.
Nice statue in a beautiful place. Must visit for all the Queen admirers. Not really much going on, but you know... Freddy... Mauntreaux...all that jazz

It seems to be a must that every Queen fan has a photo taken, by family or friends, by this slightly larger then life statue of legendary Queen frontman Freddie Mercury. You'll easily find it if you walk on the lakeside promenade in Montreux to the Casino.
Loved visiting the Freddie Mercury memorial and finding out a bit more about his relationship with Montreux, which also made us want to visit the small museum there.
Close to the lake , this statue looks glorious expressing a magnific pose of freddie. Great place to visit with friends and family
Epic scenery surrounding Freddie. Such an amazing tribute to the legend. I can see perfectly why he had a home in Montreux "it's bliss!"
Visiting this statue takes only a minute in Montreux, youll see it if you meander down the promenade for long enough. Interesting story behind its placement there.

As we walked upon the waterfront route, we came upon this statue. It is was a delightful view to be amongst, especially as the water lies in the background. Absolutely beautiful! If you are ever in these parts, please give it a visit!

I must admit I always though Freddy was a good singer, but it was until I had the chance to visit Montreux and the Memorial and the Qeen Experience that I could fully understand and admire one of the most talented human beings of the latest years. Freddy was not only an
The monument is awesome and definitely one of the landmarks of the city. It has breathtaking views from there to the Alps and Lake Geneva.
I Love the city, I love this side walk. A Sunset picture with Freddie Mercury will complete your visit of the city. Who knows ... One day I might be able to live in this wonderful city

We were originally not aware of the Freddie Mercury / Queen / Montreux connection, so we were glad to see the memorial on the edge of the lake. This lead us to the Queen Studio Experience at the Casio, which we would have otherwise missed.

We wanted to make a picture of this statue, but some hyperactive fans left too many signs that ruins the picture, so I left without it. It was not mentioned why the statue is there - would have been nice to know.
Montraux is just lovely. A walk or a cycle aling the lake for miles and miles. In the middle is the impressive statue of Freddy in his iconic pose. The chritsmas market spoiled his stance.

The views down by the statue are breathtaking. Well worth a stroll along regardless of the weather. We went in December so all of the Christmas markets were in full swing and really added to the experience.

Some think this is a random three metre statue to have in Montreux but the fact is that after opening a recording studio here, Freddie realised he loved the place so much that he bought an apartment and lived here for a while. Alongside the beautiful lake, fans gather for
The statue is located where they are also holding the Christmas Market. Apparently Freddie had settled here in Montreux after falling in love with this place.
The lake promenade would not be the same without him standing there. His energy and personality is shining through this monument to one of the greatest singers of history.

While visiting the Christmas Market, this was the added bonus. The statute of Freddie Mercury and the Queen Experience in the casino. I love his music, he was probably the best live entertainer ever. To visit the place where they made so many of their tracks is amazing. If
Nice memorial of Freddie Mercury right next to the lake. It draws a crowd and everybody wants a selfie next to it.
It was really busy but lovely to see the memorial and read the info about Freddie Mercury! The children (6,9,11) didn't get much out of it!!

Being a fan of Queen I pass this statue at least once a year when I visit my local friends. And other than just to come and say hello to Freddy, from tis spot you have one of the nicest views over the lake and the opposite mountains.

Strange thing to review really... But aesthetically impressive with the lake Geneva backdrop. If you're in the area you'll probably pass it by anyway. We came during the Christmas markets. Worth a snap and see the tributes left there

For many, many years I've been a fan from Queen and its front man Freddie Mercury. As I'm working for the MOB railway company, I often have the chance to visit Montreux. Strolling along the lake on the Promenade leads immediate to the monument of the great pretender.

It's on the sidewalk next to a Lake Geneva, you won't miss it! Very well portrayed sculpture of one of the most charismatic artists of the last century. It's obviously crowded next to a statue, so if you want to take a picture, you will have to wait for others to be done with

Freddie Mercury has been my grown daughter's favorite vocalist since she was a teenager. So it was a reason we went to Montreux in the 25th anniversary year of his death, and very exciting for her to visit his Memorial on the shores of Lake Geneva in Montreux, So many tourists

Have a listen to Bohemian Rhapsody with Freddie while gazing out over Lake Geneva. His statue is right on the waterfront at Place du Marche. If you walk east (water on your right) from Freddie, you'll come to casino Barriere on Rue de Theatre. The casino burnt down on December

This statue on the promenade is a great tribute to the rock legend. It was a highlight of my trip and an easy location to find. I knit him a wristband and attached it to add a little bling and personality to his statue.
Well... there's not much to say here. It's a very detailed statue of Freddy Mercury situated along the waterfront. There are lots of benches nearby and sit and enjoy the scenery.
In the avenue of close to the lake, near of the main "port" is the monument. Freedy was live the last part of his life in Montreux.
It's interesting to visit this statue of the famous Freddie but you don't lose anything if you don't. You may combine it with a lake walk
It is a part of the over all music theme depicted by metal sculptures all along the water front. Cool to see, but don't make a special trip
Loved being here in Montreux, at Freddie's statue, on his 70th birthday. Hope to be back for #71 next September!
Lovely nod to Sir Frederick of Mercury looking over fantastic views of Lake Geneva. A real jewel in the Swiss Riviera
It was awesome to see all the flowers and tributes visitors still leave at the lakeside memorial for this rock star who loved this beautiful city.

For a lifelong Queen fan it was great to see the place that provided Freddie Mercury with refuge in the latter stages of his life. 25 years after his departure the memory of the statue's pose is still strong in my memory.

I have listened to him singing. I remember where I was and what I was doing when they announced he had died, for me it was a pilgrimage not just a itinerary point. The bronze statue captures his personality as he looks over the lake. You can then take a short walk watching the
I loved the city when I faced it. What a beautiful day it was, flowers all around with different colors, people passing by and enjoying some small shops and drinks.
Freddie is standing proud right on the waterfront just as he should be. Stop by and get a picture with him.

For some this may just be a statue but I was fortunate to spend some time here before the crowds turned up and after they'd gone away. Many people stopped for a quick photo and walked off but if you want to spend a few minutes thinking about life then Freddie has a great spot

Really wanted to see Freddies Memorial, it was just after his birthday and people had left candles, scarves etc on it. Some tourists had trampled all over the candles cars etc., no respect such a shame. I expect it would be better when there is stuff not to trample on. The ice

Freddie's Memorial statue is on the busy promenade. Early morning is the best time to see him if you would like to take photographs without anyone behind the statue in your pictures. What a great view over Lake Geneva Freddie has!

If you are a Freddie Mercury fan then this is a must visit. The statue is worth seeing. Located centrally so you cannot miss it if you are walking the entire area. Best to visit during the Jazz Festival which is held every year.

Visited montreux in October so not as many people around, therefore a little easier to take photos without strangers on them. A decent statue of Freddie in typical pose and an opportunity for fans to pay respects.
The view from the memorial is the perfect place for pictures and is well worth a visit. It is located right on the edge of the lake.
A lovely tribute to a great singer and musician! It is situated between the ferry dock and the Eurotel Hotel.
The Freddie Mercury statue is a landmark along lake Geneva when taking a walk in Montreux. Nice place to take a few pics and chill out.

It was a nice sunny day which added to our joy as the views were simply incredible. We simply enjoyed a stroll and a movenpick ice cream whilst trying to absorb the natural beauty this area has to offer. Be patient as people flock together to take a picture with the memorial.
This statue of Freddie stands proud over Lake Geneva making his presence truly felt. I love having my photo taken peeping through his legs. I always say hello to him when visiting Montreux.
this majestic statue,wonderfully made,the actual detail are unbelievable.It is a wonderful tribute to a world class performer.The location is just perfect on the lakeside.
I am a huge freddie fan. This was a pilgrimage for me and the statue did not disappoint. A beautiful memorial for a legendary star. I love that so many people still visit and remember him.
Loved seeing Freddie on the Montreux Riviera. The statue was covered with flowers and it is right on the water, so you can take photographs with the Mountains and Lake in the back.

Well it is a majestic statue with a wonderful view.The surroundings and the dynamics of the statue add to the magic.Everybody was flocking to take a pic with Freddie and he seemed adored as he was during his lifetime.Pretty cool especially if you are a fan

Visited the statue in 2002 and 2016. A little more built up around it now. It is along the scenic walking path on the shore of Lake Geneva. The rock band Queen formerly had a studio in Montreux. Queen fans of all ages stop to have photos made at the statue. It's free to visit
a tribute to the great artist . symbol level is more likely . you can discover many other interesting things in and around this city . do not miss the Castle of Chillon.

As you are taking a mandatory stroll down the gorgeous lake you will meet Freddie Mercury. This remarkable stature of the lead singer for Queen is 10 feet tall. The day we visited it had many tributes of candles and floral bouquets. Freddie has his arm up and you feel he is

Taking a snap with Freddie is one of the must do activities in Montreux. He enjoys a place of honor front and center near where the main jazz is played. There are many other statues long the promenade and in front of the Fairmont Hotel, on the lawn area....many famous

As my outline States it was one or the other & we could not get close enough to check as there were so many people there,placing flowers,crying ,sitting down by his Memorial,taking pictures & mostly languishing around in the immediate area. The Memorial is certainly a great
I like Queen a lot so it's interesting to see a Freddie Mercury statue. Where is located is nice in front of Lake Geneva that is great. The statue is nothing special
Yes, its nice to see a bronze statue in Europe of someone you might actually admire, and even know who it was before you read the plaque.
Easy to find, great spot. It would have been Freddys 70 th birthday around time I visited. People had left flowers and notes.

Right on the lake side. Lovely setting and still to this day fans are visiting - laying flowers and reminising on the old songs ... we saw a whole gang of Freddie fans all in T shirts crying at the statue!!

If you are a Queen fan and find yourself in Montreux, then you'll have to swing by this memorial and have a photo taken, leaning against Freddie's statue, well that's whate a stream off people were doing when we passed by. Mercury had a great attachment to Montreux and lived and

You don't need to do a tour to find as it as you will pass it on your walk about in Stone Town. It is a quick photo stop with no pomp and ceremony, but if you are a fan you must go and take a photo and appreciate the moment. It is just up from Archipelago and near Livingstones.

The monument is very life like, aside from being in bronze. It stands to show how much the Swiss loved him. On the anniversary of his birthday, there were ribbons of flowers draped around the monument.
It's a statue og Freddie, no more, no less. My best friend is the worlds biggest Queen-fan, so I had to stop for a quick pic.
Read the history of Freddie and the sculptress of the statue...it's very well done and has a great vantage point of the lake which Freddie loved.

Went to Montreaux specifically to see the statue as a long time Queen fan. Looks like Freddie and lovely location looking out over the lake. Its about a 10 minute walk from the main train station. Lots of street musicians around. Also do not miss the Queen Studio Experience

I wanted so much to see one day that beautiful statue of Freddie and my dream fulfilled this year. The occasion was so great because I was here exactly for his birthday. I was one of the participants for his birthday's party from Casino Montreux. I loved the place where is the
Memorial worth photographing Symbol of the place Very centre situated thus hard to be missed. Tourists gather around it so as to take a memorable picture. Nearby a well built quai for swimming

This was our 12th visit to the statue,and with the pontoon and open air and so many friend it is like another world. as it was Freddie's 70th birthday weekend ,tables and stool were laid out and so hot and cold food was available...Fantastic and the weather was great,well on

The statue by the lake has become a shrine to Freddie Mercury, although why beats me! I guess it gives the locals another item to attract tourists - and many appear to leave flowers and cards in memory of Freddie.
You cannot miss this as you walk along the lake. Then notice all of the other plaques dedicated to music as you walk

It's one of the most moved zone in Montreux, yoh have the parking a few seconds away, the market above it, and the Freddy Mercury just near the lake, yoh can walk a few kms with an amazing and quite view. It's very pretty in the night too.
We was taking a a walk along the lake a came to the staute of Freddie Mercury it is a very nice tribute to the man and lots of people taking photos of it
to commemorate the souvenir of this important musician, friend of the important montreux jazz festival, a realist sculpture was made and place near the leman lake.
Taking a picture with Freddie Mercury is (I guess) a must :) several tourists are here and taking pics... and sometimes you Need to be Patient. The view over the lake is also nice from here...

Excellent location for this statue. Great views over the lake.A photo opportunity for any Queen/Freddie fans. Take your selfie and then visit the exhibition in the Casino to see more and learn about Queen in Montreaux and "Smoke on the Water" by Deep Purple
In all honesty I don't know why is there....he is hardly a jazz star! It seems he doesn't belong. There are a couple more statues of ' bagneuse' along the way that make more sense

Even if you didn't like Queen or Freddie Mercury this is must see. As well as the other statues located near the convention centre.

If you stay in Montreaux and walk along the lake you will find Freddie Mercury's monument - the great singer of one of the most world popular rock group Queen. Lots of people bring flowers to this monument all year round.
Located on Montreux's flower flanked promenade, this is a worthy sculpture. Queen's Mountain Studio is just a short walk away. The statue is a popular photo stop.
The statue is there in the middle of the lakeshore walk. It is good to take a quick picture. The walk is pretty.
The day I visited there were also sculptures around the lake. It was a very enjoyable visit. Views are amazing.

Located near the Covered Market, this statute honors his memory and provides a good photo op. Get off the #201 bus at "Marche Couvert" stop for easy access. His pose did strike me a little bit like John Travolta in Saturday Night Fever, but I guess that is blasphemous to true

It is about the walkway around the lake there... it is one of the most beautiful places to visit in South-West Switzerland.... or a must visit one. A beautiful walk-way that passes a number of cafes, restaurants and children playground. Fantastic lake view from there where you

... used to live and work in Montreux, his second home, and this city, whose name is strongly linked to the history of rock music, devoted this monument to its illustrious citizen and world famous rock singer. Other rock and jazz musicians have statues dedicated here, Freddie
This is a statue and brief tribute to Freddie Mercury along the waterfront promenade. Unless you are a fan, I would not recommend going out of your way to visit.
An excellent tribute to the late, great Freddie Mercury who's love for Montreux is well known. He spent the best part of his life on this wonderful area - as he said, It's Bliss!

It was interesting to see and walk by on the way from the train station to the Chillon Castle. I grew up after this era of music so I am not really a die hard fan however I am sure everyone who loved Queen would like to see this. As for the statue it was a very well done

First I knew him a one of the Queen artists, then I came to notice his amazing voice and his rare personality that did not live long enough to give us so much more. The picture next to him is one of the reasons we took that long promenade despite the poor weather.
In front of lake Geneva in Montreux must see and if you have flowers you can deposit them at the statue.
Beautiful location along the lake front in the middle of a thriving market when we visited. Interesting to learn the connection between Freddie and the Montreax area
It is a must visit landmark for Freddie Mercury Fans located on lakeside promenade in Montreux. View from here is quite nice.
Larger than life sculptor of a music icon placed in a very strategic location in a beautifully calm and relaxing town
Lots of people taking their photos with Freddy. I guess Montreux was his home in the last years of his life. It is a bronze statue full of energy located right next to the lake.

An essential statue/memorial to visit whilst in montreux, easily accessed by wheelchair. And an excellent start to the promenade along the quay, leading down to the famous casino. FYI, you even walk past a Macdonalds, that does not look all that tacky!
Eine Legende hat hier ein schönes Denkmal direkt am Genfersee erhalten. Make a selfie with him and enjoy a evening at the Lake of Geneva.
Snappy statue. How much more exciting can you get than a metal casting that looks like Mr. Mercury? I mean...seriously!
Just some steps away frome the lake, next to the market building, you'll find Freddy Mercury in his favourite pose, a statue full of energy and nostalgy...
If you are a Queen fan and are visiting Montreux, this is a must to see and photograph tribute to an icon in rock and roll - just try and get there in a quite time for your pic with Freddie

"We are the champions, (or is that champignons?). Well Freddy did it best, but the lookout is outstanding and there's places to play in the water and beautiful people walking the boardwalk. On a nice day you just drift into a zone and enjoy the atmosphere and the people watching.
This statue is located along the waterfront in Montreux. Stop by on your walk along the waterfront. It's also near a bus stop, so we caught the bus from this area to Chateau de Chillon.
It was nice to see a lovely tribute to this amazing man. It is located right by the lake , so you cant miss it.
One of the most famous things to do in Montreux. Nice statue from Fred Mercury. Must visit. Quick, nice and located at the center of Montreux.
Worth a look when in Montreux.....Freddy loved Montreux and who doesnt! A gent stroll along the shores of Lake Geneva takes you here when in Montreux.
While in Montreux, don't forget to walk along the beautiful lakeside promenade and take a selfie with Freddie Mercury. It will be hard to do anywhere else :)

Anyone who loves Queen and Freddie Mercury, as I do, must go to Montreux to see this statue and then to the casino for the Queen Studio Experience. The Freddie statue is sublime; one can just picture him looking over the lake as he composed his last songs. Montreux is
The statue is nice and we took some pictures. But all in all the sidewalk is full with booths that hide the lake and that's too bad. We had some nice gelate nearby.
Great place to visit and explore specially if you are a Queen fan! It's so magical to see this statue and also the museum located at the Casino. Really recommend to everybody!
This is a lovely place for a promenade, and during the jazz festival and during the winter time there is plenty to see with lots of arts and crafts and food bars to frequent.

It is amazing the feeling of being at Freddy mercury's memorial. It was a rainy day and still the best experience. It is a nice statue, facing the lake. It is always busy so you may have to wait to take your souvenir picture. The surroundings of Montreaux are a feast for the

Poignant, lifelike and situated with a wonderful view over the lake this is a must for any Queen fan. It's simply great. Try and go at sunset or sunrise when the sky is clear and you will get some awesome photos.

Surely you have heard of Freddie Mercury and here in Montreux, you can find his statue, right next to Lake Geneva on a promenade. You won't see locals around though, this is for the tourists. To make it all worth it, take a lakeside stroll (around 2km), from Territet-Montreux
The statue is located right on the lakefront and is a good likeness of Freddie Mercury. Very popular with fans who can stand alongside and have their photos taken with their idol.
If you are in downtown Montreux you can find Freddie Mercury lakeside. The statue is very well done and really cool that they gave him such a great spot. Would I go out of my way to see it? No.
by walking around on the lake front u are definitely going to see this metal sculpture. but there is no fanfare about it. maybe u can just tick it off as seen
Walking along the promenade in Montreaux you cannot miss the statue on the lake side almost near center of town. It is a befitting tribute to the star. Visit when on the lake.
